title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 646-7.8 - Materials, shapes, lettering, colors and decorative elements of permitted signs
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 646-7.8 - Materials, shapes, lettering, colors and decorative elements of permitted signs

State Regulations
(a) Materials. Each sign shall be constructed of wood, metal or other durable
material approved by the commission. (b) Shapes. Simple forms, such as rectangles, squares, ovals, or circles are permitted. Other forms are subject to approval
by the commission. (c) Lettering, colors, and decorative elements. These components are subject to approval by
the commission. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
§§
646-7.8

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
